entry.title: Dubai Watchdog Sounds The Alarm On Crypto Regulatory Blind Spots
entry.summary:
As the crypto industry continues to gain mainstream acceptance and adoption, regulators worldwide are grappling with how to address the unique challenges posed by this rapidly evolving sector. While some jurisdictions have embraced cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology to promote innovation and economic growth, others remain skeptical and have taken a more cautious approach to regulation.
Against this backdrop, according to a Bloomberg report, the Dubai Financial Services Authority (DFSA) has voiced its concerns about the global regulatory gaps in the market.Â
The DFSA has warned that bad actors are â€œexploitingâ€ these regulatory blind spots across the world and has called for greater coordination among regulators to prevent these activities, according to a recent Bloomberg report.â€¦

entry.title: More NFT Holders On Blur Are Taking Loans, Not Trading
entry.summary:
Recent on-chain data reveals that Blur, the peer-to-peer, zero-fee non-fungible token (NFT) marketplace and aggregator, is now more popular for facilitating loans than trading.
A report compiled by DappRadar showed that Blurâ€™s NFT loan volumes rose from 4,200 ETH (or roughly $7.6 million) to 169,900 ETH (or $308 million) in less than a month. All loans were processed through the Blur Lending protocol called Blend that was launched on May 1, 2023.
Further data reveals that NFT trading volumes have been shrinking as activity shifts to lending since early May. Trackers show that more NFT holders are creating accounts and taking loans backed with their assets.
From May 1, Blurâ€™s NFT loan trading volumes rose over 39X in 22 days, pushing the protocolâ€™s dominance in the NFT Loaning sectoâ€¦

However, another prominent figure, pro-XRP lawyer Jeremy Hogan, has predictedÂ the caseâ€™s outcome. Hogan claims that the judge in the Ripple case has been making major rulings about every 9 weeks, with the final major ruling on summary judgment expected in mid-July.
Hogan clarified that this is not a prediction but rather a pattern that has emerged in the case, , it does suggest that the caseâ€™s outcome may be decided in the coming weeks.

entry.title: Bitcoin Bullish Signal: Exchange Netflow Registers Negative Spike
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows the Bitcoin exchange netflow has registered a negative spike recently, a sign that may be bullish for the price.
Bitcoin Exchange Netflow Has Plunged In Recent Days
As pointed out by an analyst in a CryptoQuant post, a large negative spike in the netflow took place just yesterday. The â€œexchange netflowâ€ is an indicator that measures the net amount of Bitcoin thatâ€™s entering into or exiting the wallets of all centralized exchanges. Its value is naturally calculated as the inflows minus the outflows.
When the value of this metric is positive, it means a net amount of BTC is entering the wallets of these platforms right now. Since one of the main reasons why investors would deposit their coins to the exchanges is for selling-related purposes, this kind of trend can hâ€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin Mining Difficulty Poised to Break 50 Trillion Barrier, May 31 Projection Shows
entry.summary:
Despite an upswing in mining difficulty on May 18, current data projects Bitcoinâ€™s mining difficulty to see a further escalation on May 31, 2023â€”potentially jumping between 1.1% and 2.51%.
Bitcoinâ€™s Difficulty Nears 50 Trillion Milestone
Bitcoinâ€™s mining difficulty, already at an unprecedented level of 49.55 trillion, seems poised to breach the 50 trillion threshold within five days. Although the process of mining bitcoin (BTC) has become increasingly challenging, the hashrate has maintained an average rate of 364 exahash per second (EH/s) during the last 2,016 blocks. As of May 26, 2023, the hashrate hovers around 367.29 EH/s based on a 24-hour analysis.
On May 2, 2023â€”a noteworthy event in Bitcoinâ€™s lifetimeâ€”its hashrate reached a historic high at block height 787,895 with an imprâ€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin Core Version 25.0 Released Bringing New Features And Transaction Use Cases
entry.summary: Bitcoin Core version 25.0 has been released, bringing new features, bug fixes and performance improvements to the software. Users can download the latest version from the official Bitcoin Core website or update their existing installations. The release notes outline the changes and provide instructions on how to upgrade. One notable change is the allowance of transactions of non-witness size 65 bytes and above, which opens up new use cases and enhances protections against vulnerabilities like CVE-2017-12842. Another addition is the scanblocks RPC, which allows for fast wallet rescans by returning relevant blockhashes from a set of descriptors. In terms of RPC updates, all JSON-RPC methods now accept a new named parameter called "args" for passing positional parameter values conveniently. Additionally, the verifychain RPC will now return false if checks couldn't be completed at the desired depth and level, providing more accurate feedback. The release also includes changes to the build system, updated settings and new features. For instance, the shutdownnotify option allows users to specify a command to execute before Bitcoin Core begins its shutdown sequence. In the wallet section, new options like minconf and maxconf have been added to various RPCs, providing greater control over UTXO confirmations. Bitcoin Core 25.0 introduces several improvements and optimizations, enhancing the user experience and security of the software. As with any release, users are encouraged to report any bugs they encounter to the official GitHub issue tracker. Bitcoin Core is widely supported and tested on major operating systems such as Linux, macOS, and Windows. However, it is not recommended to use Bitcoin Core on unsupported systems. Users should ensure they are running a compatible operating system before upgrading to the latest version. In addition, users are encouraged to review the release notes for a detailed understanding of the improvements in this version if upgrading.

entry.title: French Lawmakers Move To Relax Regulations in Proposed Crypto Influencer Bill
entry.summary:
French lawmakers agreed to soften the strict restrictions in a crypto bill previously proposed in March. The bill aims to control the excessive impact of social influencers on digital assets.

But with the recent development, digital asset firms registered with Franceâ€™s Financial regulator, Financial Markets Authority (AMF), can now engage in influencer marketing.Â

entry.title: 2016 Crypto Hack: Bitfinex Hid a Report that Flagged Security Flaws: OCCRP
entry.summary: Cryptocurrency exchange Bitfinex never made public a confidential report that found its security lapses responsible for over 119,000 bitcoins stolen from the platform in August 2016, the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP) reported on Thursday. The stolen BTCs, worth about $3.2 billion in todayâ€™s market, were priced at $71 million at the time. OCCRP, a global network of investigative journalists, said it obtained a version of the secret report that says Bitfinex failed to execute operational, financial and technological controls recommended by its digital security partner Bitgo. The network said the report was commissioned by iFinex, the owner and operator of Bitfinex, and was produced by Canada-based blockchain services firm, Ledger Labs. Giving furtheâ€¦

entry.title: Mark Otero Shares Why a16z Invested in Azra Games' Approach to Gaming
entry.summary: What is Azra Games' approach to NFTs in gaming? Azra Games CEO Mark Otero shares his vision and why he believes his approach was a key reason Azra received investment from venture capital firms like Andreessen Horowitz (a16z).

entry.title: Funding Web3 Film Calladita With Traditional Systems 'Wasn't Working', Says Director Miguel Faus
entry.summary: Spanish Film Director Miguel Faus talks with Decrypt about how he financed his movie â€œCalladitaâ€ with NFTs. In his view, Web3 and blockchain allow creators to get around some of the key difficulties present in the traditional movie industry, specifically finding funding.

entry.title: 'Web3 Offers Something Hollywood Does Not': Film3 Pioneer, Filmmaker Jordan Bayne
entry.summary: Film3 pioneer, Metacannes and The Squad founder, Jordan Bayne discusses the advantages that crypto offers to filmmakers, notably owning their work's IP throughout the entire creation, production, and distribution processes.

entry.title: Film3 Offers 'a Whole Bunch of Independent Filmmakers' Hope, Says First Flights Co-founder Nick Sadler
entry.summary: First Flights co-founder Nick Sadler sat down with Decrypt at this year's MetaCannes festival to discuss how Web3 can support independent filmmakers by leveraging its unique blockchain-powered crowdfunding platform.

entry.title: The Film3 Movement 'Doesn't Need Competitors, it Needs Collaborators': Bingeable CEO, Founder Stephen Murray
entry.summary: Founder and CEO of Bingeable Stephen Murray unpacks how creators and filmmakers can lower the barriers for audiences to connect with their work. "Within two clicks on hearing about the movie, you're watching it," he told Decrypt at this year's MetaCannes festival.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: Defining The Web3 Stack
entry.summary: In this video, part of Infuraâ€™s Web3 Dev Series, youâ€™ll learn how to define the web3 stack in order to build full stack decentralized applications. Author: Clarissa Watson, Senior Writer at ConsenSys.

entry.title: 'Web3 Creates a Tighter Bond' Between Audiences, Creators: MyCo CCO
entry.summary: MyCoâ€™s streaming platform CCO Phil McKenzie talks with Decrypt about the Film3 movement and the Metacannes festival he helped to organize occurring alongside the Festival de Cannes. He explains how Web3 can help creators to find funding and create new ways to interact with the audience.

entry.title: Immutable's Chris Clay: Crypto Can Solve the 'Dreaded Rollback' in MMORPGs
entry.summary: Immutable VP and Gods Unchained Game Director Chris Clay tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how Immutable is actually immutableâ€”and how that changes everything for both developers and players.

entry.title: Gary Vee Discusses the Rise and Impact of AI
entry.summary: During VeeCon 2023, entrepreneur spoke with Decrypt's Andrew Hayward about the rise of AI tools, what excites him about the technology, and what kind of impact he thinks it will have on creators and business.

entry.title: Gary Vee Discusses VeeCon 2023's Broader Shift Beyond Web3
entry.summary: VeeCon is back in 2023, moving from Minneapolis to Indianapolis, and creator and entrepreneur Gary Vaynerchuk joined Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss his aim to make it the "coolest business conference in the world." And that means expanding the focus beyond NFTs and Web3 to include AI and other tech innovations, along with broader business and pop culture content.

entry.title: Gary Vee on the NFT Market and Why 'NFTs Are Stuffed Animals'
entry.summary: Gary Vaynerchuk called the NFT market decline back in 2021, but the owner of CryptoPunks and other valuable tokenized assets still believes that a sustainable market will eventually form. He joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward amid VeeCon 2023 to discuss why he thinks the NFT space will be comparable to collectible sports cards, art, and even stuffed animals.

entry.title: What Immutable's Chris Clay Learned in 23 Years of Game Development
entry.summary: Immutable VP & Gods Unchained Game Director Chris Clay tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about what it's like to work in the game industry for decades and why he's not giving up on NFT games.

entry.title: Why Azra Games CEO Mark Otero is Not a Fan of "Play-to-Earn" Games
entry.summary: "Each game is a miracle," says Azra Games CEO Mark Otero. In this clip, he shares his thoughts on "play-to-earn" games and gamer motivation with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: How Many Games Are Building On Solana? The Answer Might Surprise You
entry.summary: Solana Games General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the current state of Solana's Web3 gaming ecosystem.

entry.title: Problems With Being an 'On-Chain Purist' in Gaming
entry.summary: InfiniGods Cofounders Owen O'Donoghue and Damon Gura keep it real with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, sharing thoughts on game balancing and what to do when in-game assets become NFTs.

entry.title: Why Solana Won't Become A Web3 Game Publisher
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's Games General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Solana's "build together" approach as well as his thoughts on crypto firms becoming game publishers.
